isis.stitle: CAB: 4100, 4200, 4300 AND 4400 MODELS - INSTALL - Engine Cover And Cup Holder

svcsubproc.title: Install Engine Cover on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 124
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position engine cover (Item 4) inside cab. Slide engine cover under dash panel, lift bottom front edge of engine cover over transmission shift lever shaft (Item 4, Figure 125) , if so equipped, and slide it completely under dash panel.
Pull floor mat (Item 5) from under bottom edge of the engine cover (Item 4) to allow engine cover mounting hole flanges to rest on the cab floor.

Pull floor mat (Item 5, view circle B) back away from bottom edge across the front of the engine cover (Item 4, view circle B). Install hex flanged bolt (Item 7, view circle B) through engine cover into cab floor. Do not tighten.

Pull floor mat (Item 5, view circle C) back away from bottom edge across the front of the engine cover (Item 4, view circle C). Install hex flanged bolt (Item 8, view circle C) through engine cover into cab floor. Do not tighten.

Pull floor mat (Item 5, view circle A) back away from bottom edge on driver side of the engine cover (Item 4, view circle A). Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 6, view circle A) on driver side of the engine cover through engine cover into cab floor. Do not tighten.

Pull floor mat (Item 5, view circle D and E) back away from bottom edge on passenger side of the engine cover (Item 4, view circle D and E). Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 9, view circle D and E) on passenger side of the engine cover through engine cover into cab floor. Do not tighten.
Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 3) at the top of the engine cover (Item 4) through engine cover into dash panel. Do not tighten.
Once all hex flanged bolts (Items 3, 6, 7, 8 and 9) have been installed, tighten them to 77 to 95 lbf-in (8.7 to 10.7 N•m).

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 125
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On a vehicle with standard transmission and air brakes, install gear shift lever (Item 2) with rubber boot (Item 1). If the rubber boot is not on the gear shift lever, slide the rubber boot over the gear shift lever before installing gear shift lever.

Hold rubber boot (Item 1) up on the gear shift lever (Item 2) and install gear shift lever onto transmission shift lever shaft (Item 4). Install allen screw (Item 3) securing gear shift lever to transmission shift lever shaft and tighten.
Install rubber boot (Item 1) into cab floor around the gear shift lever (Item 2).

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 124
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On a vehicle with automatic transmission and hydraulic brakes, position hydraulic hand brake lever (Item 2) in place on the cab floor and install four hex flanged bolts (Item 1) through the hydraulic hand brake lever mounting flange into the cab floor. Tighten to 77 to 95 lbf-in (8.7 to 10.7 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cup Holder on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 123
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If so equipped, install cup holder and ashtray (Item 4) as follows.

Position cup holder and ashtray (Item 4) underneath center dash panel (Item 1), slide cup holder and ashtray forward to hook the back of the cup holder and ashtray to the underside of the center dash panel. Install two torx head screws (Item 3) through the front center dash panel into the cup holder and ashtray. Tighten them to 20 to 25 lbf-in (2.3 to 3.0 N•m).
Position the center dash panel trim bezel (Item 2) in place over the center dash panel (Item 1). Carefully push it into center dash panel until it snaps into place.

Install passenger bucket seat, fixed passenger seat and/or fixed passenger bench seat, refer to SEATS
.
